gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Interface SurfaceElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<SurfaceElement>, Node
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContiguousSurfaceElement
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSurfaceElement, GappedMultiWord, MultiWord, Word

    public interface SurfaceElement
extends Node, java.lang.Comparable<SurfaceElement>
    An interface to represent textual units. A textual unit may be a single word, a multi-word token or a textual unit with gaps (e.g., give up in give this up).

    Each textual unit is enclosed by a Sentence, has an id, index, lemma, part-of-speech, syntactic category, and a head. It may be associated with a number of SemanticItem objects, that represent the semantics of the textual unit.

    In rare cases, a textual unit (a GappedMultiWord) may extend beyond a sentence (e.g., On one hand .... On the other hand ....), but even in those cases, the unit is primarily associated with one sentence only.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu
    See Also:
    AbstractSurfaceElement, ContiguousSurfaceElement, Word, MultiWord, GappedMultiWord

    • Field Detail

      • SPAN_ORDER

        static final java.util.Comparator<SurfaceElement> SPAN_ORDER
        Span-based comparison of textual units. The textual unit that appears earlier in text is given precedence.

      • getCategory

        java.lang.String getCategory()
        Returns a higher-level POS category.

        It is used to abstract away from tense information, and such. For example, if the POS is 'VBZ', it returns 'VB', if the POS is 'NNS', it returns 'NN'.

        Returns:
        the category of the textual unit

      • filterSemanticsByClass

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterSemanticsByClass(java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        Gets all semantic items of a given class associated with this textual unit.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the semantic object class (Entity, Predicate, etc.) provided with their canonical class name
        Returns:
        all semantic items with the given type that are associated with the textual unit, null if the textual unit is semantically empty

      • filterByEntities

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByEntities()
        Returns:
        only Entity objects associated with the textual unit

      • filterByPredicates

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByPredicates()
        Returns:
        only Predicate objects

      • filterByTerms

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByTerms()
        Returns all atomic terms (Entity and Predicate).
        Returns:
        the set of atomic terms

      • filterByRelations

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByRelations()
        Returns:
        only Relation objects.

      • getHeadSemantics

        java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getHeadSemantics()
        Finds the semantic items associated specifically with the head of the textual unit.

        This is usually the most prominent semantic object associated with the textual unit.

        Returns:
        the semantic objects associated with the head word, null if the textual unit is semantically empty

      • containsAnyToken

        Returns true if the textual unit contains any of the tokens in a list, ignoring case.

        Returns:
        true if the textual unit contains any of the token.
